If your review is incorrectly listed, please react with ð to this comment and the bot will ignore it on the next update.
<!--174a7506f384e20aa4161008e828411d-->
### Conflicts
Reviewers, this pull request conflicts with the following ones:

* [#27385](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/27385) (net, refactor: extract Network and BIP155Network logic to node/network by jonatack)
* [#27213](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/27213) (p2p: Diversify automatic outbound connections with respect to networks by amitiuttarwar)
* [#25908](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/25908) (p2p: remove adjusted time by fanquake)
* [#25572](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/25572) (refactor: Introduce EvictionManager and use it for the inbound eviction logic by dergoegge)
* [#25268](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/25268) (refactor: Introduce EvictionManager by dergoegge)
* [#23352](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/23352) (test: Extend stale_tip_peer_management test by MarcoFalke)
* [#17860](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/17860) (fuzz: BIP 42, BIP 30, CVE-2018-17144 by MarcoFalke)

If you consider this pull request important, please also help to review the conflicting pull requests. Ideally, start with the one that should be merged first.
<!--2502f1a698b3751726fa55edcda76cd3-->

| Branches  | -0.0140 %            | 51.7670 %        |

<sup>Updated at: 2020-03-30T13:59:49.217418.</sup>

ACK faaba842d03762591f8612fd1fb16c93c881913f 
Ran functional tests on Ubuntu 16 and glanced through the code.
Added a commit to remove a shared global in the test, which caused non-determinism.
Force pushed a `CConnmanTest::ReceiveMsgFrom` to separate the test logic from the net logic

ACK fadb1acd1392d42b08d5b27360764c83e94b42ae
Ran functional tests.

<!--cf906140f33d8803c4a75a2196329ecb-->
ð This pull request conflicts with the target branch and [needs rebase](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#rebasing-changes).

<!--cf906140f33d8803c4a75a2196329ecb-->
ð This pull request conflicts with the target branch and [needs rebase](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#rebasing-changes).
Concept ACK to be notified on rebase.
This seems unrelated to `std::chrono::` / time refactoring.
Can you clarify why you're using `count_seconds` here rather than `.load().count()`?

The type of `time - g_last_tip_update.load()` should be assumed to be `std::chrono::something`, but the exact type should be assumed to be unknown, since it can change in a future refactor. Therefore, we need to somehow specify what precision we want to log to the debug log.

Using the `count_*` helpers is one way and I bet there are also other ways to achieve the same.
I recommend reviewing #18638 , which adds documentation to `count_seconds`
@MarcoFalke could you rebase this (if there isn't any other PR that should be reviewed first), and comment in regards to: https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/18470#discussion_r431027856.

<!--cf906140f33d8803c4a75a2196329ecb-->
